A Summations

Insertion Sort

Sort cards in your hand one at a time

Imagine sorting a hand of playing cards. You pick up one card at a time and insert it into its correct position among the cards you've already sorted.

How It Works

  1. Start with the second element (first is 'sorted')
  2. Compare current element with sorted elements to its left
  3. Shift larger elements right to make room
  4. Insert the element in its correct position
  5. Repeat for all remaining elements

Complexity

  • Time Best: O(n) - already sorted
  • Time Avg: O(n²)
  • Time Worst: O(n²) - reverse sorted
  • Space: O(1) - in-place

When to Use

  • Small arrays (< 50 elements)
  • Nearly sorted data
  • Online sorting (data arrives one at a time)
  • Simple implementation needed
